body:
Could you update the gesv docs to say we support 1D `B` (self)? The docs currently imply  that `gesv` only supports 2D `B` (self).

It looks like the old THCTensor_(gesv) doesn't support 1D self but the THTensor_(gesv) supports both 2D and 1D self:
https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/7b375ed362c4da833c38691b6bf3ade0941d3bf1/aten/src/THC/generic/THCTensorMathMagma.cu#L66-L67
body_html:
Could you update the gesv docs to say we support 1D B (self)? The docs currently imply that gesv only supports 2D B (self).

It looks like the old THCTensor_(gesv) doesn't support 1D self but the THTensor_(gesv) supports both 2D and 1D self:

pytorch/aten/src/THC/generic/THCTensorMathMagma.cu

Lines 66 to 67 in 7b375ed

THArgCheck(!a_->is_empty() && a_->dim() == 2, 1, "A should be (non-empty) 2 dimensional");
THArgCheck(!b_->is_empty() && b_->dim() == 2, 2, "b should be (non-empty) 2 dimensional");
body_text:
Could you update the gesv docs to say we support 1D B (self)? The docs currently imply  that gesv only supports 2D B (self).
It looks like the old THCTensor_(gesv) doesn't support 1D self but the THTensor_(gesv) supports both 2D and 1D self:

  
    
      pytorch/aten/src/THC/generic/THCTensorMathMagma.cu
    
    
        Lines 66 to 67
      in
      7b375ed
    
    
    
    

        
          
           THArgCheck(!a_->is_empty() && a_->dim() == 2, 1, "A should be (non-empty) 2 dimensional"); 
        

        
          
           THArgCheck(!b_->is_empty() && b_->dim() == 2, 2, "b should be (non-empty) 2 dimensional");
